summary: The "coal by-products industry" encompasses the production and management of by-products generated during coal extraction and processing. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this industry is subject to various directives aimed at environmental protection, waste management, and sustainable resource utilization. The EU emphasizes the importance of minimizing the environmental impact of coal by-products, promoting recycling and recovery processes. Additionally, regulations such as the Waste Framework Directive and the Industrial Emissions Directive play a crucial role in governing the handling and disposal of these by-products, ensuring compliance with stringent environmental standards and fostering a transition towards a circular economy.
